31.text:
This has been an emotionally-charged week for the cat-loving community of Manila.  The saddest part is, what happened to the #catsofbgc happens everywhere, and all the time. The week may have ended - but at the silent gathering of kindred spirits, we hope it also means a the beginning of some positive change.  Bringing justice to these cats is not just that - it's really about fighting for all who are voiceless and unwanted in this world.

#catlivesmatter #alllivesmatter #wheninmanilapets #wimpets #catcareph #shareaseat #adoptdontshop #beautybeyondbreed #neuteriscuter #tribute #inmemoriam #rescuecats #tnr #communitycats

32.text:
May you always be safe.  May the sad fate that had befallen your furry pals not have been in vain. May more and more people love and fight for you from now on. 
This gathering was not just for the #catsofbgc, not even just for stray and abandoned cats, but for all who are voiceless and undervalued.  May the world be a better place for you.

78.text:
My Charlie is now 12 years old and is still the joy of my life together with Pipita🐱 and Dewey🐶. She was rescued from the streets all the way from Bulacan. I say that cat lives matter. And that there is beauty beyond breed. There is more meaning to adopt or rescue a cat or dog as compared to buying from a pet store. I am speaking from experience. 
I am happy that there is a growing number of people who are already adopting and rescuing from the streets here in the Philippines. It’s such a norm in “first” world countries like Australia. It is my dream that our country will also embrace this. Hoping it will start this lunar new year, “the year of the dog”. I say again, “Cat Lives Matter”. I am hoping and praying that the missing #CatsofBGC be found. And that everyone will learn from this unfortunate event. 
1. Cats are not pests
2. There is already the Animal Welfare Act in the Philippines. RA 8485 with amended RA 10631 with emphasis to consequences when you violate this law. 
3. The most humane way of controlling cat [and dog] overpopulation is TNR. Contact Local Animal Welfare groups like CARA and PAWS for more information. 
4. As a result of TNR, these Spayed and Neutered Cats in the community will protect us from rodents, cockroaches, and snakes. They are the “natural” pest control. 
5. Education is still the answer. Ignorance is never an excuse, most specially to our Laws. 
#southiegurl #cara #caravolunteer #animalwelfare #animalwelfareadvocate #vegan #fortheanimals #adoptdontshop #rescued #beautybeyondreed #cats #dogs

80.text: Back in Manila, animal welfare advocates and #catlovers are full of anger and sadness because about 30 community cats that live in the Park in BGC, across from #shangrilathefort were removed over time culminating their dissapearance just a day or two before valentines day. The carers and volunteers who feeds them on a daily basis noticed them missing. It was found out that the very 5 star Shangrilathefort rang #Pestsbustersphilippines to remove the cats, which was done secretly at nights! Cats are not pests and pestbusters have no right to remove the cats. After much outcry from the netizens and catloverd  it has made the local newspapers and tv and efforts have been carried out to find the #cats! The problem is the location given for relocations sitedhave been changing and shang has just now publicly apologised for their stupidity while pestbuster's office is closed and not taking calls. These cats have been fixed and vaccinated and released . CARA, non profit volunteer based org helped with getting these cats fixed. It is so sad to think what their fate has turned into! Those involved violated the Animal Welfare Act! So many people are also boycotting the hotel because #catslivesmatter! #catsofbgc #boycottshangrilathefort #animalcruelty #bringbackthecats #wherearethecatsofbgc #catsarenotpests #shameonyoushangrilathefort #mad (credit goes to owner of the photo)

83.text: Empress Chabi, former member of the #catsofcpc, a cat colony that @cacasiglos and I supported. What @shangrilafort did with the @catsofbgc only reinforces our decision last year to bring the remaining 15 home. Difficult as that is, the alternative was worse. Some would just go missing, Ms Ives was brutally mutilated, and most were constantly subjected to threats. All this, despite there being no biting or scratching incidents, and they were all vaccinated, spayed, and neutered. I know they’d suffer the same fate as the #catsofbgc sooner or later. It’s been a wild and exhausting year, but the peace of mind I gained by having them home is more than worth it. #catsofinstagram #adoptdontshop #rescueisthebestbreed #catcarephilippines #puspin #pusangpinoy #proudpuspin #catsofcapiz

84.text:
🌹We can’t just wish for a happy ever after.... Visiting BGC yesterday was just not the same since the #shangrilafort Hotel decided to ‘remove’ the ever infamous @catsofbgc :( I will never understand how someone had the right to make this decision. I am obviously a cat lover, but I do understand that not everyone is; however I don’t know how you couldn’t get even a little smile from watching children feed the kittens or see them sleeping in the sun. They are not pests, like rats or cockroaches (which I may add will be seen a lot more now the cats are gone!) 💔
My heart hurts for how deflated and defeated the people who spend their time, money and energy on ensuring these cats were vaccinated, neutered and fed, must feel. They were a well looked after, clean and healthy colony. 🐈 It highlights the importance of education and how far we still have to go. Stand by the mission and values of organisations such as #Cara and #paws, as well as so many amazing individuals fighting for the same cause, to humanely reduce the stray cat population and animal cruelty in the PH. 
As a member of the public you may notice the loss of the cats and if you do.. you can help. A positive can come from such a terrible situation. You may feel you can’t do much, like many of us do, but even if you do one thing it’s better than nothing. Donate, take a cat to be TNR, foster or adopt. I speak from experience when I say I wish I did more - but I know I do what I can. Every act of kindness can have an ongoing affect on a cats life. There are still cats needing forever homes from BGC... You could give them a second chance. -

97.text:
Risk, Issues & Crisis Management: #CatsOfBGC and what we can all learn from it .
.

Over the past week, Shangri-La at the Fort has landed in hot water for hiring a pest control agency to relocate the stray cats residing on its property. .
.

The situation is a PR nightmare, if ever there was one.
So what should Shangri-La do to gain back the public’s trust and goodwill? .
.
. . “Shang's apology needed to include an admission of their shortcomings: Something like: ‘Clearly, we need to be more sensitive towards the animals of our locale. Moving forward we will make animal sensitivity training with CARA, mandatory for all operations personnel. Additionally we were not very communicative or collaborative with our local community. From here on out we will make  it a point to keep open lines of communication with the rest of our community, and let people know when we are doing something that could affect them. We are very sorry for our shortcomings here. We will make it a point to do right next time.’”
.
.

105.text: In the past few days, we have received overwhelming support from  people we've known online and from people we have never even met. Messages of encouragement and stories of how the #CatsOfBGC have become part of their routine and daily lives were shared, and it brings us much joy that the cats in BGC gave so much to all these people (including us of course!). From the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much! And the cats may not speak like us, but we are certainly sure that's what they all want to say. That's also why we'd like to share with you a personal story from someone who was just so so sooo tired but then, a moment with the cats changed it all. (The following texts contains mentions of depression/suicide, if you are emotionally sensitive regarding those, kindly refrain from reading) "I guess that was around end of October last year. I entered the plateau of my depression.  Sobrang lala na kasi ng problems sa life and everything. My problems got the best of me. I was lamenting on how I should end my life back then... should I jump? sleeping pills overdose? hang by the noose? burn myself? those things. Di alam ng family ko yung plan ko nun pero alam ng friends ko and dear lord how they persuaded me to not do the unspeakable. kaso matigas ang ulo ko eh. I was determined to do it. I was about to do it nung October 28 pero may pumigil sa akin nun pero I already set another date, November 5, 2017. walang nakakaalam nung nov 5 plan. Death by blunt force trauma. tatalon kasi ako mula sa 6th floor ng university ko. (that's the highest point in our uni). I have like a week left, so I finished all of my org stuff para kahit wala ako kaya ng org makahanap ng kapalit ko after nov 5. May pa last post na rin sana ako sa blog ko, last will, and handwritten letters to everyone I deeply regard. Funny enough, ni isa sa mga yun wala akong prinepare para sa family ko except for my little sister which was a letter I wrote to her. Pero I know naman na di pababasahin ng mom ko yung letter sa kanya so I set it aside... Please read the full story in our Facebook Page.

114.text:
Composing this post is hard. I need to recall what happened and on top of that, the #CatsOfBGC issue broke out. I'm feeling a tightness in my throat ever since Saturday. We lost Mari (Mari-chu as well call her) on a Saturday afternoon.

We had a follow up check-up last Wednesday (14Feb). The vet commented on the improvements and had us continue with the medication. She also increased her food intake. We feed her using a syringe. Friday evening, she ate a little. We just thought that maybe she had too much food during the afternoon feeding. Saturday morning came and she has no appetite. She started to breathe heavily and we immediately went to the vet. We had her confined hoping she will pull through. We got a message in the afternoon. I didn't want to touch my phone. It's either another bad news about the BGC cats or it's about Mari. Both ended in a bad way. 
I feel inadequate, angry, sad... I want to blame someone. I want to blame the person who abandoned her, who left her exposed that lead to her sickness. I'm also angry that the Cats of BGC were taken away by pest exterminators. The world is getting smaller, people and corporations are getting greedier, and smaller creatures like Mari are the casualties.

Still, always look for the helpers. I see a great community at CatCarePH. Members listened and purchased our items when we asked for help to pay for Mari's bills. Volunteers who looked for the missing cats although they are stressed and tired from their day jobs. A partner that supports me no matter what. Thank you.

I'll end my post. The tightness in my throat is still here.

:: 11NOV2017 :: BGC, TAGUIG CITY :: 👣
💭 Just read the articles about the Shang cats and much of it explained why they’ve gradually gone missing. Every time I get around the Shang area, these little furballs would always give a warm greeting along the way. But I probably won’t be seeing most of them again anytime soon. 149.text:
The BGC cats are a well-managed colony of cats fed and looked after by community volunteers. They are spayed/neutered with complete vaccines, all expenses paid out of the volunteers' pockets. They have a social media following where they are being adopted out. They even have their own food bowls and names.

People used to visit the BGC park just to see and feed them until Shangri-la eradicated them through Pest Busters. Now, they're nowhere to be found. It's the 5th day since they're gone. Shanhgri-la can't even disclose where the cats were "relocated". Or were they? They might have even been disposed as "pests". All the press releases of Shangri-la have been evasive and only produced more questions than answer. Pure BS.

Currently, efforts are being made by CARA and volunteers to search the 39 missing cats in areas where they were allegedly "relocated" in the hopes of finding them and bring them home. The cat community demands the return of  the BGC cats to their home - dead or alive.

#CatsOfBGC
#JusticeForTheCatsOfBGC
#WhereAreTheCats
#BringTheCatsofBGCBack
#CorporateSocialIrresponsibility
#ShangIna

159.text:
Let me give you a little background on why finding those cats mean so much to me. 
About three years ago, we were looking for a cat to adopt to be a companion for our baby Bugg. August of 2014 was when Amelia chose us.

Steve was walking along Serendra when he saw this tiny tiny kitten trying to cross the street. He immediately scooped her up and looked for her family. Sadly, no other cats were there so he decided to bring her home. I remember this first photo he sent along with the message "look what I got!" Our little girl Amelia is one of those BGC cats. Look at how she evolved into this beautiful creature that gives us joy everyday. I wish this kind of joy for everyone. It cannot be explained and maybe non-pet lovers will never understand.

Let us try to open our homes to these wonderful creatures. I assure you that your life will never be the same again.

#AdoptDontShop #cats #BringBacktheCatsofBGC #CatsofBGC @Catsofbgc @carawelfareph

165.text:
I want to share something about the #CatsofBGC issue that has been spreading fast. But first, let me introduce this place. .

It's located somewhere past The Heritage Park, left turn along Bayani Road. "PUSSY CATS' KINGDOM," the little blue made-up house said. This photo was taken when @bjanbernabe and I traveled by foot (morning "workout") last November 2017. Whoever set that up there, we have no idea. Wala namang naka-bantay. There was a note written that said, "Hindi iponan ng mga pusa. 'Wag maglagay ng maliliit na pusa, di pa kumakain." We found two cats finding shelter from the 9am heat. It's a cute and nice home for these stray cats, but not the best and proper one thay they can have.
.

The situation of the cats in BGC is almost the same story, except there's no blue made-up house. We were very fond of them, kaya lagi namin silang dinadaanan after our morning jogs. There was "Bungo," with his black markings on the face forming like a skull. This brown-streaked, playful cat I would've named Darth Invader (LOL; also coz it just invades private space). A pregnant cat that we haven't named yet (would've loved to name her Fiona coz that sounds like a pretty cat, doesn't it).
.

They are super friendly and they love receiving lambing from people who pass by. But they do not *really* belong there. They are all stray cats, roaming around someone else's property. I'm not defending Shangri-la's action. And that's not the point of this long post (thank you for reading up to this point btw). Maybe this issue puts light to the overwhelming number of stray cats. If you want to help out these cats (and more), please #AdoptNotShop. There are a lot of kindhearted groups and organizations that tend to stray cats until a parent decides to take them home (my friend @fatimoir handles @catsforadoptionph). A lot of street cats need shelter and love. Instead of burning down Shangri-La the Fort, take a lovely feline, or two, home. Go back to the root of the problem: they need shelter. Be their home. .

Side note: I LOVE cats but I can't take them home. Maybe when I finally live on my own.

166.text: Well, that escalated quickly! Hoho. From an almost perfect ratings before the BGC cats hullabaloo, it has gone down to just 2.1 stars and it will continuously dwindle as more and more concerned and outraged netizens leave ratings on your page. Serves you right, Shangri-la BGC! What you did to those community cats is an abomination so be ready to take the backlash of your thoughtless act! You are unethical, uncompassionate, selfish and have no regard for life. It is ironic that you are in the hospitality field and your hotel's name means Utopia -where everything is beautiful, peaceful and harmonious- yet how you treated those poor innocent cats is the complete opposite. Is that what you call social responsibility? Most of those cats have probably lived in BGC longer than you have yet you got the audacity to displace them from the park which isn't even your property? Wow! Shame on you! Those cats are even well taken care of, vaccinated, spayed and neutered; you didn't consider how the people who take care of them would feel. I am reading a lot of comments from BGC residents and those who work there about how fond they were of the cats, how they bonded with them, they even feed them regularly and now they're heartbroken with the disappearance of their feline friends; I no longer live in BGC but my heart breaks for them too. 💔 If it's any consolation, I'm touched with the outpouring love and concern people from all walks of life -most of which are professionals, executives, expats- are showing not just to those poor BGC felines but all cats in general. On a lighter note, I think dagdag pogi points mga professional, good-looking men who speak up for the cat's rights. Haha. Compassion is 💕. #justiceforBGCcats #animalwelfare #catsofbgc #animalrights #catsofinstagram #catlovers #shangrila

167.text:
The kind of people we are is reflected in how we treat our stray animals, and I feel that some of us have gone to the lowest low by taking the stray cats of BGC away, getting rid of them like their lives don’t matter. I shall never trust people who do not show kindness to animals. I will keep on teaching my one-year-old niece to be kind to animals because that’s the closest she can have to giving unconditional love. I am saddened, angry.

Please bring back the cats of BGC. The lives of these cats matter. They matter to us. And we are outraged that we have people in our midst who can do this deed without mercy, without compassion, without remorse. #bgc #catsofbgc #catsofinstagram #cats #shangrila #shangrilathefort #shangrilafort #catlivesmatter #bringbackthecats

170.text:
This is a screenshot of @shangrilafort 's statement as posted on @carawelfareph 's FB page. 
1) If you truly were concerned about the welfare of the cats, YOU DO NOT HIRE A PEST CONTROL COMPANY TO HANDLE THEM. By doing so you have already shown bias and that any humane approach was thown out the window. You already labeled them as PESTS and have taken actions to treat them as such. 
2) Adopted by Staff Members. Then prove it. 
3) Given Cara exact locations? NO YOU DID NOT.
4) LEARNING EXPERIENCE? What idiots (not to mention heartless souls) you must be to not know that there are actual laws against such actions. And once again, you effing hired a PEST CONTROL COMPANY. 
5) You dont get to hide behind vague statements that you are helping CARA. And in the process insinuating that the entire issue was blown out of proportion by netizens, who are only after painting a negative picture of you. We gain nothing from that. 
6) Go right ahead, fool yourselves into thinking that you did not take part in hurting innocent lives. Bacause by forcibly and inhumanely relocating them you have put these cats' lives at risk. At night, before you sleep, you know that the truth about yourselves will haunt you.

Let us help @carawelfareph and @catsofbgc find them.

CATS ARE NOT PESTS TO BEGIN WITH. 
The hiring of Pest Busters by @shangrilafort to destroy a community of cats who have been thriving peacefully in the area (thanks to @catsofbgc and other animal welfare groups) is irresponsible and cruel no matter which angle you try to look at. It is a violation of RA 8485 or the Animal Welfare Law. Shangri-la has released a statement claiming the cats were adopted while others were relocated, yet unable to show proof of such claims. 
This company boasts about their CSR projects around the globe which includes caring for the nature, yet such act greatly demonstrates their hypocrisy. 
Shangri-la The Fort MUST bring back ALL the cats you took AND pay for violating the law. #wheninmanila #wimpets #catsofBGC #catsofManila #Taguig #animalcruelty #cats #catsofinstagram #puspins #puspinsofmeownila #puspinsofmanila #CARA #CARAWelfare #PAWS #PART #animalwelfare #savethecatsofbgc #PETA #cats #kittens

186.text:
Help return the cats! 😢🐱 Share, tag, sign. Let the world know about what's going on. These cats need all the help

Animal lovers are saddened when we found out that the beloved cats of BGC (a well-known area here in the Phillipines) where captured and dumped elsewhere by  a pest control company under the order of the management of the newly built Shangri-La at the Fort just because the cats "ruins the hotel's aesthetics". Those cats are well taken cared of by volunteers, residents, office workers and even strangers who visit BGC. Most of them are fixed and are fully vaccinated. The hotel management did not coordinate with the LGU or the animal welfare volunteers who take care of the cats about their plan. Instead, they hired a pest control company, whom by law, is not authorized to handle the task.
The hotel released a statement that some of the cats were adopted and some where "relocated" somewhere else. The current condition of these cats still remains to be seen as @catsofbgc are still looking for them. The has not issued any apologies nor displayed acceptance of their wrong-doing. There were also reports that some netizens who left a negative review on the hotel's FB page were hacked and the reviews were deleted. 
Such an under-handed move coming from a big company. Hope that all the cats are safe and found.

To know more about what happened, check these articles:
👉http://www.wheninmanila.com/what-happened-to-the-cats-of-bgc/
👉 http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/969674/loss-of-taguig-park-cats-sparks-outcry

283.text:
We're so happy to hear that more #catsofbgc were spayed/neutered. The cats will be returned, though--which means they are still in danger of being taken to the pound where they will be euthanized if unclaimed. Please consider adopting and/or getting in touch with your community admins to propose humane solutions to the stray cat population. -------------
Repost from @catsofbgc 
Last Friday, some of the new (and very hard-to-catch!) #CatsOfBGC received something from CARA Welfare Philippines (@carawelfareph ) that will keep their lives happier, healthier and longer: the gift of spaying/neutering! 
See, spaying/neutering don't just prevent cats from breeding and further overpopulating. When you spay/neuter your kitty, you're preventing it from: acquiring diseases transmitted through mating with other cats, roaming and running away, fighting with other cats, AND spraying smelly urine/wailing like crazy!! Here are just some of the photos from the TNR (#TrapNeuterRelease) activity made possible by our wonderful friends from CARA. You can even see our spayed/neutered BGC kitties comforting their inexperienced friends! Truly, that afternoon was filled with love and compassion--from hoomans and kitties alike! 
Since 2000, CARA (Compassion And Responsibility for Animals) has been serving as a non-profit,non-government organization for animal lovers. You may help them save more lives through spaying/neutering by donating to their cause. Thank you, CARA! Please visit https://www.caraphil.org/mainsite/get-involved/donate/ for more details. #AdoptDontShop

349.text:
CatsOfBGCStories:

Hi, my name is Max. 😽🐾 I'm female and around 2 months or 2 and a half months old. I was rescued and was sent to the nearby vet. The vet gave me Max as my name but I didn't complain even though it's a male name. 😸 I heard that Max believes to be a lucky name! Oh how lucky I really am! 
Recently, they did a blood test. White blood cell improved from 50k to 33k, anemia worsened despite good appetite and supplementation. They have also dewormed me. They will increase the dosage of iron supplements. I heard I will probably stay in the hospital for another week. Please pray for my quick recovery! I thank you so much @zoeezequiel who rescued me and will be my future mom! 😻 I can't wait to spend my days in my furrever home. Thank you. 🙏🏻❤️ -Max 🐾😸 #catsofinstagram #CatsOfBGC #adoptdontshop

387.text:
Did you know?: 🤔😻 Ginger tabbies, also called red or orange tabbies, are white striped with any shade of orange or red. Tabby patterns include classic swirls, mackerel, ticked and spotted, but all have the typical “M” on the forehead. The wild ancestors of today’s domestic cats probably sported the tabby pattern – it provides good camouflage for sneaking up on prey or unsuspecting creatures that venture into your yard – and the tabby pattern is often seen in ancient depictions of cats. That attractive ginger color is a naturally occurring mutation.

https://pets.thenest.com/ginger-tabby-personality-10180.html

409.text:
1/2 After our dinner, we decided to passed by Shangri-La The Fort and saw these gorgeous cats of BGC. These are stray cats, and I always wonder how they can survive. Unexpectedly, we saw this guy (we called him Mr. Ochi) feeding them and seems they know him for awhile. Me and my bestfriend @allaboutlexa_  decided to stopped-by and talked to him. For almost 30-minutes, we learned that he is homeless, but currently looking for a job, and also feeding these stray cats because he is worried for them. It was a very meaningful 30-minutes and we learned how humble he is and his great compassion for them.

I am thankful that someone is taking care of them. He said he is relying to good people who give him catfoods, and even some good people also feeding them but not enough. 
Can you believe that there are 34 stray cats now in Bonifacio High Street, and they are already part of this beautiful community?! How awesome is that!

But then these cats needs help. If you happen to visit @bonifaciohighstreet , please bring some catfoods for them. They are loving creatures, and  part of our community. Also if someone out there have a good heart to help Mr. Ochi to get a job, please do. He have a good heart.

He have nothing, but still trying to give something for these cats. 
A person like him who have this great compassion is someone worth your time. 
More stories on my blog soon. *

461.text:
07/31/17

So a colleague has cats of his own, and he noticed I like cats because this particular cat visits around the building where I work, and I stay outside after work beside her at times to pet her. He gave me cat food to feed that cat, and she noticed me from then on; not until the cat food ran out, she doesn't care about me again.

In these photos, she was that far from me, and a second after taking her picture, she noticed me behind her, then started meowing. She knew I got food for her so I put down my bag on one of the nearby outdoor seats, and handed her some pellets. Look how close she was in the second photo after handing her the food~

Sometimes, or maybe most of the time, I find cats interesting, fierce, and lazy. Interesting because they do not have to impress people to love them. Fierce because cats around our residential area eat birds (sorry for this brutality--animal food chain is real), and their claws and sharp teeth make me see them as fierce creatures however small they are. Lazy because... They just are.

Sorry, I'm just sharing my love for cats. 😂 sharing some random stories with you. Have a good day!

#catsofbgc

601.text: I can't believe I haven't posted about this cat family yet. On our continued high street adventures (it's very close and a good place to walk and T. doesn't have a car because in this part of town you really don't need one and also the traffic here is vaguely terrifying), we have now encountered the same little cat family three nights in a row. I think that means they're ours, at least for the duration of my stay. 😊 A few kittens and a mom cat, who is VERY pregnant again. I don't know for sure that she's the mom to this particular group of adolescent cats - she seems too young to be on anything other than her first litter, but I mean, a huge population breeding freely...who knows?! Anyway I was up by 7 this morning because of course I was, so I went out to give them some breakfast snacks and to say hi. Mostly they were asleep but they didn't seem to mind the interruption. I wish we could do something to care for the mom cat through the upcoming litter (and then get her neutered!), but T. isn't supposed to have pets in his apartment, and honestly taking on the cat of a nursing mom and babies really is a lot. Sigh. I love having so many cats around but population control is so important. #cats #catsofig #catstagram #catsofinstagram #catsofbgc

614.text:
After meeting with our Property Management Office, our community cats whose stay has been threatened has decided to make them stay and live their peaceful lives. We showed them TNR programs done in places like Greenbelt, Serendra, Ateneo, BHS, etc. the advantages of spaying and neutering, how community cats can be natural pesticides in keeping rodents and roaches away, and of course reiterated the Animal Welfare Act. 
As a compromise, we have a designated feeding area so the babies don't liter around. Litterboxes will also be placed in strategic areas as well. 
I believe that cats can co-exist with humans, whether you love them or not. Let's make the world a better place for everyone. (Our neighborhood condo community cats have been spayed and neutered via @carawelfarephils and we do this in batches. Volunteer homeowners sponsor these from their own money. We also feed these cats and provide fresh water and we've been doing this for years). #TNR #spayandneuter #catsofmanila #catsofbgc #puspin

616.text:
Final post for tonight is our 1000th post! Thank you to everyone who followed, liked and shared a little of their time with us. And as we are celebrating this Yuletide season, the birth of our saviour Jesus Christ, on behalf of Elmo, Katzu, Chubaka, Alexis, Ash, Avatar, Muffin, and the rest of the fantasticfelinesph family, we wish everyone a blessed and Merry Christmas! Thank you Our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ for all the blessings we received.

647.text: When I was younger, I used to bring home kittens from unusual places. Some ask me to take care of their cats too instead of them being put away. Last sunday, after my shift, I heard loud cries in one of the parking lots of bgc. They definitely stole my heart when I saw them. Ive been visiting them daily and feeding them with milk from 711. As much as I wish to bring them home, I could not since we have several cats now at home. They were thrown out together with their mom by their supposed human. Just couldnt trace the mom cat. I do hope they will grow healthy and adjust to the surroundings in bgc. #cats #catsofbgc #mykutings
